intro: Zaluzianskya pulvinata, commonly known as the snowball vine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its trailing growth habit. The plant produces clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers that resemble snowballs, hence its common name. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated as a decorative plant. Its foliage is typically heart-shaped and covered in a fine, silky hair.
